currentStudents.name: Djavan De Clercq
currentStudents.shortBio:
Djavan is a part-time DPhil student conducting research at the intersection of agriculture and climatic change. He is currently a consultant at McKinsey & Company. Djavan has experience in engineering, data science, venture capital, consulting, teaching, and entrepreneurship, in China, Europe, and the United States.

Djavan holds a PhD and an MSc from Tsinghua University in Environmental Science & Engineering, an MEng from UC Berkeley in Industrial Engineering & Operations Research, and a BA from Sciences Po Paris. He has published in journals such as Applied Energy, Renewable & Sustainable Energy Reviews, and Bioresource Technology.
currentStudents.longBio:

He has published in journals such as Applied Energy, Renewable & Sustainable Energy Reviews, and Bioresource Technology.

currentStudents.name: Andrew M. Bean
currentStudents.shortBio:
Andrew is a DPhil student in Social Data Science at the OII. His research focuses on cooperative artificial intelligence. He studies potential types of human-AI cooperation, the nature of those interactions, and necessary developments to enable that cooperation. On the technical side, he has studied applied machine learning, especially reinforcement learning and natural language processing, for their applications to developing AI.
Andrew holds a B.S. in Applied Mathematics from Yale University and an MSc in Social Data Science from the OII. He is a Clarendon Scholar and was previously a Thouron Prize winner at the University of Cambridge (Pembroke College).
currentStudents.longBio:

currentStudents.name: Yushi Yang
currentStudents.shortBio:
Yushi is a DPhil student in Social Data Science at the OII, and a data scientist. Her research focuses on interpretability methods to improve the safety of large language models.

Yushi holds an MSc in Statistical Science from the University of Oxford and an MSc in Artificial Intelligence from Imperial College London. Before that, she held a BSc in Mathematics, Operation Research, Statistics, and Economics from the University of Warwick. Prior to the DPhil, she interned with UNDP as a data analyst, at Oxford and Imperial College London as a machine learning researcher, and at a start-up as a data scientist.

Yushi's experience includes a range of data science projects, developing machine learning models to build privacy-preserving recommender systems, track brand sentiment in online news, and predict US gun violence diffusion rates. Her skillsets include Python, R, SQL, deep learning models, and AWS SageMaker

currentStudents.name: Harry Mayne
currentStudents.focus: LLM interpretability, AI safety, LLM evals
currentStudents.shortBio: Harry's DPhil focuses on language model explainability and interpretability. His current research explores whether models can reliably explain their outputs in natural language, and what the implications are for broader human-computer interaction. Harry has previously worked on mechanistic interpretability problems and continues to contribute to this area.
currentStudents.longBio: Harry's DPhil focuses on language model explainability and interpretability. Harry has previously worked on mechanistic interpretability problems and continues to contribute to this area.

currentStudents.name: Ryan Othniel Kearns
currentStudents.focus: science of evals, reasoning in LLMs
currentStudents.shortBio: Ryan Othniel Kearns is an MSc and incoming DPhil student in the Reasoning with Machines AI Lab, generously supported by the Clarendon Scholarship. His research focuses on understanding reasoning in large language models (LLMs) and the science of AI evaluations. Previously, Ryan studied Philosophy (BAH) and Computer Science (BS) at Stanford University.
currentStudents.longBio: Ryan Othniel Kearns is an MSc and incoming DPhil student in the Reasoning with Machines AI Lab, generously supported by the Clarendon Scholarship. His research focuses on understanding reasoning in large language models (LLMs) and the science of AI evaluations. Previously, Ryan studied Philosophy (BAH) and Computer Science (BS) at Stanford University.

currentStudents.name: Shreyansh Padarha
currentStudents.shortBio:
Shreyansh holds a BSc in Data Science and has experience working at startups, where he developed AI-driven solutions for film, TV production, and advertising. He has also conducted cross-functional research in Malaysia, where he developed clinical models for dental care. His research work also includes infusing computer vision in cattle domestication and opinion mining rhetoric of LLMs on social media.
Shreyansh is passionate about leveraging data-driven approaches to tackle pressing social issues, including biodiversity conservation, climate change mitigation, early medical detection, and extremism behaviour detection.

currentStudents.name: Mattéo Larrodé
currentStudents.shortBio: Mattéo holds a BSc in Philosophy, Politics and Economics with Social Data Science from UCL. He has worked as a data scientist for the British Red Cross and is interested in using data science and open-source solutions for humanitarian decision-making.
